result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:32 PM - case called.   Defendant Annie M Imbrie in court.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer in court for Annie M Imbrie.  State has previously filed an Amended Information.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding victim rights.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  In receipt - waive reading - plea of not guilty.  Court accepts not guilty plea.  Bond will continue.

10:30 AM - case called.  Defendant Annie M Imbrie in court.  Attorney Andrew R Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer in court for Annie M Imbrie.  State has complied with victim rights.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding status of this matter.  Sgt. Investigator Logan Lange duly sworn and testifies.  Direct by Atty Polzin.  Defendant identified by Sgt. Investigator Lange.  Cross by Atty Restemayer.  Redirect by Atty Polzin.  Recross by Atty Restemayer.  Argument by Atty Restemayer.  Rebuttal by Atty Polzin.  Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and binds the Defendant over for further proceedings.  Information filed with the Court.  Statement by Atty Polzin - needs time to amended Information.  Statement by Atty Polzin regarding modification of bond conditions.  Response by Atty Restemayer.  Court grants State's motion to modify the bond conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
